The fire was caused by the coal - gangue accumulation under the belt, the stuck and worn - through return idler at the - 63.3 - meter elevation, and the sliding friction between the severely worn belt and the return idler, which generated high temperature and sparks, igniting the accumulated coal powder. After the emergency shutdown, the stationary belt was ignited, and the fire spread rapidly due to the unqualified flame - retardant performance of the belt, the large dip angle of the roadway, and the upward ventilation, resulting in the mixed combustion of the belt and coal.
